{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 45-year-old African-American woman with a history of nonproductive cough, fatigue, weight loss, and hemoptysis. She has a 2.5-cm nodule with irregular borders at the apex of the left lung on chest x-ray. She does not smoke but drinks alcohol. The most likely diagnosis in this patient is squamous cell carcinoma of the lung. Squamous cell carcinoma is strongly associated with smoking, but it can also occur in non-smokers. It commonly presents with cough, hemoptysis, weight loss, and a lung nodule on imaging. The patient's history, physical examination findings, and imaging findings are most consistent with squamous cell carcinoma of the lung.", "answer_choice": "C. Squamous cell carcinoma of the lung"}
